en: I consider her to be an honest woman.
zh: 我认为她是个诚实的女人。

en: I think she's an honest woman.
zh: 我觉得她是个诚实的女人。

en: I persuaded her to substitute for me in that job.
zh: 我说服她代替我做那份工作。

en: I admire her truly.
I cannot but believe her.
I was able to help her.
I treated her as my own daughter.
zh: 我把她当成自己的女儿一样对待。

en: I had a good opinion of her.
I couldn't stop myself from longing for her.
I want to make her happy.
I don't like her.
I will make her happy.
I never see her without thinking of her mother.
zh: 每次见到她，我都会想起她的母亲。

en: I was looking at her.
I excited her.
I cannot excuse her.
I can't forgive her.
I can't excuse her.
I saw her home.
I took her home.
I look on her as my best friend.
zh: 我把她看作是我最好的朋友。

en: I think of her as my closest friend.
zh: 我把她当成我最亲密的朋友。

en: I can comfort her.
I don't love her, not even if she loves me.
I can't help loving her.
I don't love her.
I know her well. She is my friend.
zh: 我了解她。她是我的朋友。

en: I know her well.
I turned away as if I didn't like her.
zh: 我转过身去，好像我不喜欢她一样。

en: I wanted to surprise her.
I suggested to him that she be invited to the party.
zh: 我建议他邀请她参加聚会。

en: I know her very well.
I asked her for a date, only to have her say no.
zh: 我约她出去，结果她拒绝了。

en: I asked her for a date.
I asked her out on a date.
I caught a glimpse of her.
I know her slightly.
I hugged her tightly.
I thought her very clever.
I mistook her for Ann's sister.
zh: 我把她误认为是安的妹妹。

en: I cannot praise her enough.
zh: 我对她的赞美怎么都不够。

en: I thought she was pretty.
I have known her for two years.
Although I am her elder, she treats me as if I were her servant.
zh: 虽然我是她的长辈，但她待我就像对待她的仆人一样。

en: I love you more than her.
I love you more than I love her.
I think she is a good dancer.
zh: 我觉得她跳舞跳得很好。

en: I think she is sick.
I took her arm.
I thought it better that she should take a vacation.
I listened to her story.
I believe her story.
I was completely deceived by her story.
zh: 我完全被她的故事欺骗了。

en: I don't like the way she speaks.
zh: 我不喜欢她说话的方式。

en: I gave in to her demands.
I was charmed by her way of speaking.
zh: 我被她说话的方式迷住了。

en: I was deceived by her appearance.
I like her sense of style. Her clothes and makeup always look good.
zh: 我喜欢她的时尚品味。她的衣服和妆容总是很好看。

en: I was taken in by her promise.
I greatly admire her for her bravery.
I tried to avoid looking at her eyes.
zh: 我尽量避免看她的眼睛。

en: I can't think of her name at once.
zh: 我一时想不起她的名字。

en: I can't remember how to spell her name.
zh: 我不记得她的名字怎么拼写了。

en: I felt drawn toward her.
I dislike her unfriendly attitude.
zh: 我不喜欢她不友好的态度。

en: I'm very concerned about her illness.
I was fascinated by her beauty.
I got very annoyed at her remarks.
I guessed her to be 40.
I guessed her to be 40 years old.
I was impatient for her arrival.
zh: 我迫不及待地等待她的到来。

en: I tried to find out her telephone number.
zh: 我试图找出她的电话号码。

en: I wrote down her phone number.
zh: 我记下了她的电话号码。

en: I interpreted her silence as a refusal.
zh: 我把她的沉默理解为拒绝。

en: I don't like her manner.
I'm fed up with her laziness.
I was moved by her love for other people.
zh: 我被她对别人的爱感动了。

en: I was offended by her crude manners.
zh: 我被她粗鲁的举止冒犯了。

en: I sat beside her.
I pulled her by the sleeve, but she went on talking unconcernedly.
zh: 我拽了拽她的袖子，但她若无其事地继续说着。

en: I had to take care of her baby.
zh: 我不得不照顾她的孩子。

en: I thanked her for her kind hospitality.
I gave her a present in return for her kindness.
zh: 我送了她一份礼物，以回报她的好意。

en: I noted a trace of eagerness in her voice.
zh: 我注意到她声音里有一丝渴望。

en: I had a good laugh at her joke.
I don't like the way she laughs.
I accepted her invitation.
I like her novel.
I can't do without her help.
I spent several days sorting through her papers.
zh: 我花了几天时间整理她的文件。

en: I can't remember her address.
I don't know her address.
I must answer her letter.
I believe what is written in her letter.
zh: 我相信她信里写的内容。

en: I can remember the warmth of her hands.
zh: 我能记得她手心的温暖。

en: I can't stand her jealousy.
I noticed her hands shaking.
zh: 我注意到她的手在颤抖。

en: I called her office, but no one answered.
zh: 我给她办公室打了电话，但是没人接。

en: I congratulated her on her success in the examination.
I stood still, my whole attention fixed on the movements of her fingers.
zh: 我一动不动地站着，全部注意力都集中在她手指的动作上。

en: I helped her with her work.
I have done with her job.
zh: 我已经做完了她的工作。

en: I like her dark eyes.
I read anger in her face.
zh: 我从她的脸上看到了愤怒。

en: I could not catch her words.
I gathered from her words that she liked him.
zh: 我从她的话里听出她喜欢他。

en: I gathered from what she said that she liked him.
zh: 我从她所说的话中听出她喜欢他。

en: I couldn't for the most part make out what she said.
zh: 我基本上没听懂她在说什么。

en: I took what she said literally.
zh: 我按字面意思理解了她的话。

en: I can hardly understand what she says.
zh: 我几乎听不懂她在说什么。

en: I'm sick of her excuses.
I heard her to the end.
I'm anxious about her health.
I don't know the reason for her absence.
zh: 我不知道她缺席的原因。

en: I'm fed up with her complaints.
I can't make her out.
I took a close shot of her face.
zh: 我给她脸部拍了个特写。

en: I caught a glimpse of her face.
I saw sorrow's print upon her face.
zh: 我看到悲伤在她脸上留下的痕迹。

en: I stared her in the face.
I was keyed up over her impending operation.
zh: 我为她即将到来的手术感到紧张。

en: I focused the camera on her face.
zh: 我把相机对准了她的脸。

en: I was fascinated by her sweet voice.
zh: 我被她甜美的声音迷住了。

en: I was full of curiosity about her past.
zh: 我对她的过去充满了好奇。

en: I was entranced by her singing.
I appreciated her sentiments.
I made her play the piano against her will.
zh: 我强迫她违背意愿地弹钢琴。

en: I was anxious for her safety.
zh: 我为她的安全感到焦虑。

en: I am concerned for her safety.
I gave a bunch of roses to her in return for her hospitality.
zh: 为了感谢她的款待，我送了她一大束玫瑰。

en: I regret having fallen in love with a girl like her.
zh: 我后悔爱上了她这样的女孩。

en: I repeated the word several times for her.
zh: 为了她，我重复了好几遍那个词。

en: I will do anything I can do for her.
I'm immediately behind her.
I like her style; she's aggressive and knows what she wants.
zh: 我喜欢她的风格；她很有攻击性，并且知道自己想要什么。

en: I was amazed by her quick response.
zh: 我对她快速的反应感到惊讶。

en: I kept an eye on her suitcase.
I am not acquainted with her.
I'm not acquainted with her.
I was worried on her account.
I'm going to her cocktail party.
zh: 我要去参加她的鸡尾酒会。

en: I plan to go to her cocktail party.
zh: 我计划去参加她的鸡尾酒会。

en: I can make out what she said.
I can understand what she is saying.
I got her a wrist watch.
I bought her a watch.
I have three times as many books as she has.
I lent her 500 dollars free of interest.
I told her to tell me the truth, but she shook her head.
zh: 我告诉她要告诉我真相，但她摇了摇头。

en: I followed her into the room.
I got her to clean my room.
zh: 我让她把我的房间打扫干净了。

en: I asked her a difficult question.
zh: 我问了她一个很难的问题。

en: I asked her if she knew his address.
zh: 我问她是否知道他的地址。

en: I gave her a comic book to read.
zh: 我给了她一本漫画书看。

en: I tried to ask her a riddle.
I want her to do the difficult work.
zh: 我想让她做这份困难的工作。

en: I called her up.
I meant to call her, but I forgot to.
zh: 我本想给她打电话，但我忘记了。

en: I ran as fast as possible to catch up with her.
zh: 我尽可能快地跑去追赶她。

en: I ran as fast as I could to catch up with her.
zh: 我尽我所能地跑去追赶她。

en: I ran into her in the street.
I wrote a long letter to her.
zh: 我给她写了一封很长的信。

en: I advised her to catch a morning train.
I bought her a nice Christmas present.
zh: 我给她买了一份很棒的圣诞礼物。

en: I informed her about the success.
zh: 我把成功的事情告诉了她。

en: I sent her a doll.
I ought to have told her the truth.
zh: 我本应该告诉她真相的。

en: I have a deep affection for her.
I can't afford to buy her a new dress.
zh: 我买不起给她买一件新裙子。

en: I gave her what little information I had.
zh: 我把我所知道的少量信息都告诉她了。

en: I have no time to write to her.
I remember writing to her.
I charmed a secret out of her.
zh: 我从她那里套出了一个秘密。

en: I must make an apology to her.
I lent her my camera.
zh: 我把我的相机借给了她。

en: I showed her my room.
I was disappointed in her.
I didn't have the courage to tell her the fact.
zh: 我没有勇气告诉她真相。

en: I didn't have the courage to tell her the truth.
zh: 我没有勇气告诉她真相。

en: I informed her of my arrival.
zh: 我通知了她我到达的消息。

en: I informed her of my success.
zh: 我通知了她我成功的消息。

en: I informed her of my departure.
zh: 我通知了她我离开的消息。

en: I asked her if I could read the book.
zh: 我问她我是否可以看这本书。

en: I wanted her to come here this evening.
zh: 我想让她今天晚上来这里。

en: I told her not to go.
I demanded that she should go.
I am going to let her do as she likes.
zh: 我打算让她做她喜欢做的事。

en: I persuaded her to make herself comfortable.
I told her to quickly finish the report.
zh: 我告诉她赶紧完成报告。

en: I would like to express my gratitude to her.
zh: 我想向她表达我的感谢。

en: I said to her, "You look pale. Are you all right?"
zh: 我对她说：“你脸色苍白，你没事吧？”

en: Hardly had I met her when I fell in love with her.
zh: 我刚见到她就爱上了她。

en: I recognized her as soon as I saw her.
zh: 我一看到她就认出她了。

en: I knew her the instant I saw her.
zh: 我一见到她就认出她了。

en: I am glad to see her.
I hope that I'll see her.
I'll give her some flowers.
I said nothing to her, which made her upset.
zh: 我什么也没对她说，这让她很不高兴。

en: I met her at the station, but I did not recognize her in uniform.
zh: 我在车站遇到了她，但我没认出穿制服的她。

en: I told her not to let go of the rope, but she did.
zh: 我告诉她不要松开绳子，但她还是松开了。

en: I am ashamed of not having been kind to her.
I counseled her to wait a little longer.
I have made up my mind to propose to her.
zh: 我已经下定决心向她求婚了。

en: I'm not at all satisfied with her.
I told her what to do.
I made her a dress.
zh: 我给她做了一件连衣裙。

en: I remember having seen her some place.
zh: 我记得在某个地方见过她。

en: I meet her on occasion at the club.
zh: 我偶尔在俱乐部碰到她。

en: I was very worried about her.
I had difficulty convincing her of the dangers of smoking.
I promised her not to do it again.
I debated whether to ask her about it or not.
zh: 我犹豫着是否要问她这件事。

en: I was aching to tell her the secret.
zh: 我渴望告诉她这个秘密。

en: I told her I'd keep it secret, so I've kept that to myself.
zh: 我告诉她我会保守秘密，所以我一直保守着。

en: I don't like her to go in such a dress.
zh: 我不喜欢她穿这样的衣服去。

en: I asked her if she could go to the party.
zh: 我问她是否能去参加聚会。

en: I did that which she asked me to do.
zh: 我做了她要求我做的事。

en: I bought a wonderful watch for her.
zh: 我给她买了一块很棒的手表。

en: I argued her out of going skiing.
I don't think she is capable of doing this job. To start with, she is far too old.
zh: 我不认为她能胜任这份工作。首先，她年纪太大了。

en: I bade good night to her.
I wished her a good night.
I offered to lend money to her.
I bought her a toy cat, but she wasn't happy with it.
zh: 我给她买了一个玩具猫，但她并不喜欢。

en: I advised her to come by 9:00.
I told her to be home by nine.
zh: 我告诉她九点之前必须回家。

en: I asked her to pick me up around four.
zh: 我让她四点左右来接我。

en: I met her three days ago.
I am going to stop her ever doing that again.
zh: 我不会再让她做那种事了。

en: I'm going to stop her from ever doing that again.
zh: 我不会再让她做那种事了。

en: I made sure to not let her do such a thing again.
zh: 我确保不再让她做那样的事情。

en: I told her she looked pale, and asked if she was all right.
zh: 我告诉她她脸色苍白，问她是否没事。

en: I owe her 100,000 yen.
I told her to do that work at once.
zh: 我告诉她立刻去做那项工作。

en: I had a lot of difficulty getting in touch with her.
I want to talk to her.
I had nothing to do with her.
I am friends with her.
I made friends with her.
I want to get in touch with her.
I couldn't tell her from sister.
I will part company with her.
I plan to break up with her.
I am glad to have her company.
I told her once and for all that I would not go shopping with her.
zh: 我一劳永逸地告诉她我不会和她一起去购物。

en: I told her once and for all that I wouldn't go shopping with her.
zh: 我一劳永逸地告诉她我不会和她一起去购物。

en: I talked to her on the telephone.
I talked with her to my heart's content.
I can't tell her from her twin sister.
zh: 我分不出她和她的双胞胎姐妹。

en: I exchange letters with her.
I am engaged to her.
I'm engaged to her.
I have known her for five years.
I made up my mind to marry her.
I want to make her acquaintance.
I had a nice chat with her.
I intended to go with her, but I was too busy.
zh: 我本来打算和她一起去的，但是我太忙了。

en: I'd like to go on a picnic with her.
I talked with her for an hour.
I spoke with her for one hour.
I shook hands with her.
I agreed with her.
I almost never met her.
I am nearly as tall as she.
She and I are about the same height.
I said that I didn't go shopping with her.
zh: 我说我没和她一起去购物。

en: I have been acquainted with her for more than 20 years.
zh: 我认识她已经超过20年了。

en: I've known her for a long time.
I didn't get along with her.
I've been on close terms with her since childhood.
zh: 我从小就和她关系很好。

en: I'll never forget going to Hawaii with her.
zh: 我永远不会忘记和她一起去夏威夷。

en: I met her the year that my uncle William died.
zh: 我遇到她的那年，我叔叔威廉去世了。

en: I canceled an appointment with her.
I have to talk with her about the new plan.
zh: 我得和她谈谈新的计划。

en: I know better than to quarrel with her.
I'd like to go skiing with her.
I accompanied her on a walk.
I have kept company with her for about 10 years.
I talked to her for an hour.
The longer I listen to her, the less I like her.
zh: 我越听她说话，就越不喜欢她。

en: The more I listen to her, the less I like her.
zh: 我越听她说话，就越不喜欢她。

en: I know them.
I know those women.
I know those girls.
I waited for her to speak.
I tried to efface the memory of her tears.
zh: 我试图抹去她流泪的记忆。

en: I tried to forget that she had cried.
I tried to erase the memory of her crying.
zh: 我试图抹去她哭泣的记忆。

en: I wait here until she comes.
I'll wait here until she comes.
I was all the more worried for her silence.
I think that she will discuss trade friction.
zh: 我认为她会讨论贸易摩擦。

en: I know that she has been busy.
I helped her hang the picture on the wall.
I saw her clean the room.
I didn't notice her going out of the room.
zh: 我没注意到她走出房间。

en: I have never seen her help her father.
zh: 我从未见过她帮助她的父亲。

en: I never saw her help her father.
zh: 我从未见过她帮助她的父亲。

en: I was disappointed at her absence.
zh: 我对她的缺席感到失望。

en: I was disappointed that she was not at home.
zh: 我对她不在家感到失望。

en: I hope she will get over her disease.
I was given to understand that she was ill.
zh: 我得到的理解是她生病了。

en: I didn't know that she was ill.
I didn't know she was ill.
I know that she is beautiful.
I remember the horror I felt when she screamed.
zh: 我记得她尖叫时我感到的恐惧。

en: I was afraid of her having been punished.
I saw her at it with great enthusiasm.
zh: 我看到她兴致勃勃地做这件事。

en: I saw her doing that with enthusiasm.
zh: 我看到她兴致勃勃地做那件事。

en: I was glad that she visited me unexpectedly.
zh: 她意外地来拜访我，我很高兴。

en: I saw her crossing the street.
I have known her since she was a baby.
zh: 她还是个婴儿的时候我就认识她了。

en: I insist that she was honest.
zh: 我坚持认为她是诚实的。

en: I was delighted at the news of her success.
zh: 听到她成功的消息，我很高兴。

en: I noticed that she was wearing new glasses.
zh: 我注意到她戴了新的眼镜。

en: I noticed she was wearing a new hat.
zh: 我注意到她戴了一顶新帽子。

en: I think she is kind.
I made a bet that she would win the game.
I heard her singing in her room.
zh: 我听到她在房间里唱歌。

en: I received a letter which was written by her.
zh: 我收到了一封她写的信。

en: I objected to her treating me like a child.
zh: 我反对她像对待孩子一样对待我。

en: I was thinking about what she had said to me.
zh: 我一直在想她对我说过的话。

en: I take it for granted that she will join us.
zh: 我理所当然地认为她会加入我们。

en: I have known her since she was a child.
zh: 她还是个孩子的时候我就认识她了。

en: I wish her happiness.
I helped her wash dishes.
I could hardly make out what she said.
zh: 我几乎听不清她在说什么。

en: I hope she will get well.
I am growing to hate the girl.
zh: 我越来越讨厌那个女孩了。

en: I'm beginning to hate her.
I'm starting to dislike her.
I arrived at the moment she was leaving.
zh: 我到达的时候她正要离开。

en: I heard her singing a song.
I think it certain that she will succeed as a singer.
zh: 我认为她一定会成为一个成功的歌手。

en: I have never heard her sing.
I heard her sing a song.
I couldn't figure out what she was talking about.
zh: 我搞不清楚她在说什么。

en: I have no idea where she lives.
I don't know where she lives.
I saw her swim.
I heard her speak English fluently.
zh: 我听见她说一口流利的英语。

en: I suggested that she go alone.
She gave me several books.
I got a letter from her.
I was invited to dinner by her.
I was expecting a letter from her.
zh: 我一直在期待她的来信。

en: I was very glad to get a present from her.
zh: 我很高兴收到她送的礼物。

en: Not a letter did I receive from her.
zh: 我没有收到她的一封信。

en: I didn't receive even one letter from her.
zh: 我甚至没有收到她的一封信。

en: I didn't even receive one letter from her.
zh: 我甚至没有收到她的一封信。

en: I didn't even get one letter from her.
zh: 我甚至没有收到她的一封信。

en: I didn't get even one letter from her.
zh: 我甚至没有收到她的一封信。

en: I asked her if she had been to Mexico.
zh: 我问她是否去过墨西哥。

en: I allowed her to go to the party.
I can't bear to see her cry.
I did not notice how she was dressed.
zh: 我没有注意到她穿什么衣服。

en: I didn't notice how she was dressed.
zh: 我没有注意到她穿什么衣服。

en: I asked where she lived.
I cannot make out what she is driving at.
zh: 我弄不明白她到底想说什么。

en: I am quite in the dark as to what she is going to do.
zh: 我完全不清楚她要做什么。

en: I gave her just what she needed.
I am surprised that she should have done such a thing.
zh: 我很惊讶她竟然会做这样的事。

en: I'm surprised that she did such a thing.
zh: 我很惊讶她做了这样的事。

en: I'm surprised she did such a thing.
zh: 我很惊讶她做了这样的事。

en: I found out that it was difficult for her to solve that problem.
zh: 我发现她很难解决那个问题。

en: I object to her going there alone.
I know that she is Spanish.
I found her mending a skirt.
I know that she is cute.
I was not conscious of her presence.
zh: 我没有意识到她的存在。

en: I was fascinated by her opera singing.
zh: 我被她的歌剧演唱迷住了。

en: I do not know when she can come.
zh: 我不知道她什么时候能来。

en: I don't know when she got married.
zh: 我不知道她什么时候结婚的。

en: I have never heard her say 'No'.
I tried to stop him but he made off in a hurry.
zh: 我试图阻止他，但他匆匆逃走了。

en: I would sooner starve than betray him.
zh: 我宁愿饿死也不会背叛他。

en: I relied on him.
I thought him clever.
I considered him a friend.
I cannot but admire him.
I forced him into complying with my wish.
zh: 我强迫他顺从我的意愿。

en: I am going to call on him tomorrow.
I made him go.
I will make a friend of him.
I intended to have called on him, but I couldn't.
zh: 我本来打算去拜访他的，但是我没能去。

en: I have never called on him.
I didn't call on him because I wanted to.
zh: 我拜访他不是因为我想去。

en: He cast reflections on me.
I showed him into the room.
I visited him only to find him absent.
zh: 我去拜访他，结果他不在。

en: Much as I pitied him, I could not help him.
zh: 我很同情他，但我帮不了他。

en: I took him for his brother.
zh: 我把他误认成他哥哥了。

en: I mistook him for his brother.
zh: 我把他错当成他哥哥了。

en: I planned to introduce him to her.
I made an ass of him.
I made fun of him.
I imagined him a tall man.
I rate him among the best modern composers in Japan.
zh: 我认为他是日本最好的现代作曲家之一。

en: I met him at Tokyo Station.
zh: 我在东京车站遇见了他。

en: I was careful not to say anything to make him angry.
zh: 我小心翼翼，没说任何会让他生气的话。

en: I have made him angry.
I regard him as an enemy.
I called him up on the phone.
I regarded him as the best doctor in town.
zh: 我把他看作是镇上最好的医生。

en: I came to know him.
I thought him very clever.
I feel very sorry for him.
I consider him a great writer.
zh: 我认为他是一位伟大的作家。

en: I think he's a great writer.
zh: 我觉得他是个很棒的作家。

en: I have a great regard for him.
I'm waiting for him.
Far from respecting him, I dislike him.
zh: 我非但不尊重他，反而讨厌他。

en: I think highly of him.
I have absolute trust in him.
I trust him completely.
I don't know him at all.
I tried to persuade him, but in vain.
zh: 我试图说服他，但没有成功。

en: I've managed to talk him into buying a new bed.
zh: 我设法说服他买了一张新床。

en: I persuaded him to give himself up to the police.
I persuaded him to be examined by the doctor.
I persuaded him to go to the party.
I persuaded him into accepting the offer.
zh: 我说服他接受了这份提议。

en: I can't find fault with him.
I believe him honest.
I thought that he was honest.
I thought he was honest.
I think of him as one of my good friends.
zh: 我把他当成我的好朋友之一。

en: I look on him as my best friend.
zh: 我把他看作我最好的朋友。

en: I took him for my close friend.
zh: 我把他当作我的亲密朋友。

en: I trust him because he never tells a lie.
zh: 我信任他，因为他从不说谎。

en: I have trust in him.
I have confidence in him.
I trust him.
I don't trust him; be careful what you say when he's around.
zh: 我不信任他；他人在场时，说话要小心。

en: I was foolish enough to believe him.
I could not help laughing at him.
I have a mind to help him.
I went to the airport to meet him.
I help him.
I took him for my brother.
zh: 我把他当成了我的兄弟。

en: I thought he was my brother.
I thought he was my younger brother.
I mistook him for my brother.
zh: 我把他错认成我的兄弟。

en: I have him eating out of my hand.
I regard him as a poet.
I intended to have visited him at his office.
zh: 我本打算去他的办公室拜访他。

en: I made him my servant.
I invited him to my house.
I can't bend him to my will.
I tried but failed to stop him.
zh: 我试着阻止他，但失败了。

en: I decided that he should be transferred to the branch.
zh: 我决定把他调到分公司。

en: I second his nomination.
I look up to him as my teacher.
zh: 我把他当作我的老师一样尊敬。

en: I took him out for a walk.
I gave him a ride in my car last night.
zh: 昨晚我开车送了他一程。

en: I have a high opinion of him.
I went to the hospital to visit him.
I was astonished at sight of him.
zh: 我看到他时感到很惊讶。

en: I recognized the actor the minute I saw him.
zh: 我一看到他就认出了那个演员。

en: I supposed him to be rich.
I thought that he was rich.
I thought he was rich.
I scared him out of cheating on the exam.
zh: 我吓唬他，让他不敢在考试中作弊。

en: I took him to the Kyoto Imperial Palace.
I cannot forgive him because he insulted me in public.
zh: 我不能原谅他，因为他在公共场合侮辱了我。

en: I can't help feeling sorry for him.
I said so with a view to pleasing him.
zh: 我说那样的话是为了取悦他。

en: I tried to please him, which I found very difficult.
zh: 我试图取悦他，但我发现这非常困难。

en: I did so with a view to pleasing him.
zh: 我这样做是为了取悦他。

en: I barely restrained the impulse to strike him.
zh: 我勉强克制住打他的冲动。

en: When I called him right-wing, I mean that his thinking is old-fashioned.
zh: 我说他是右翼，意思是他的思想很老套。

en: I tried to stop him, but he left me behind.
zh: 我试图阻止他，但他把我甩在了后面。

en: I conducted him out.
I consider him a great scientist.
zh: 我认为他是一位伟大的科学家。

en: I am well acquainted with him.
I took him aside.
I remember him well.
I regarded him as a good teacher.
zh: 我把他看作是一位好老师。

en: I pointed at him.
I can't make him out at all.
I call him Mike.
I looked on him as the boss.
I took him for Mr Brown.
zh: 我把他当成了布朗先生。

en: I mistook him for Mr. Brown.
zh: 我把他错认成了布朗先生。

en: I have a fine contempt for him.
I know him very well.
I couldn't help admiring him.
I made him go there at once.
It is a fact that I dislike him.
I felt bad about picking on him.
I will make him go.
I think him a good teacher.
I think that he's a good teacher.
I don't care for him.
I want to surprise him.
I saw her at the station five days ago, that is, last Friday.
zh: 五天前，也就是上周五，我在车站看到了她。

en: I saw her at the train station five days ago, that is, last Friday.
zh: 五天前，也就是上周五，我在火车站看到了她。

en: I am to pick him up at five.
I won't let him come here again.
zh: 我不会再让他来这里了。

en: I waited for him for an hour.
I waited up for him until ten o'clock.
zh: 我一直等到十点才睡觉等他。

en: I know both of them.
I am quite unqualified to teach them.
zh: 我完全没有资格教他们。

en: I went to the airport to see them off.
I dropped them off at Kanda.
zh: 我在神田把他们放下了。

en: I do not know any of them.
zh: 他们之中我一个都不认识。

en: I don't know any of them.
zh: 他们之中我一个都不认识。

en: I suppose they are coming.
I think they must be twins, but she says they cannot be so.
zh: 我觉得他们一定是双胞胎，但她说他们不可能是。

en: I gave way to their demands.
zh: 我向他们的要求让步了。

en: I cannot meet their demands.
zh: 我无法满足他们的要求。

en: I interpreted their silence as consent.
zh: 我把他们的沉默理解为同意。

en: I know none of them.
zh: 他们之中我一个都不认识。

en: I must prepare their breakfast.
zh: 我必须准备他们的早餐。

en: I do not know every one of them.
zh: 他们之中我不是每个人都认识。

en: I know all of them.
I asked for their approval.
I sincerely hope for their happiness.
zh: 我真诚地希望他们幸福。

en: I sat among them.
I believe in what they said.
I like their pictures.
I will never forget their warm hands.
zh: 我永远不会忘记他们温暖的双手。

en: I saw through their plot at once.
zh: 我一下子就看穿了他们的阴谋。

en: I gave three pencils to each of them.
zh: 我给了他们每个人三支铅笔。

en: I am not concerned with their trouble.
I have nothing to do with their troubles.
I know neither of them.
I am ignorant of the reason for their quarrel.
zh: 我不知道他们争吵的原因。

en: I don't know why they are fighting.
zh: 我不知道他们为什么打架。

en: I ordered them to leave the room.
I was being made a fool of.
I sympathized with them, and promised that I would do what I could to help.
zh: 我同情他们，并承诺我会尽我所能帮助他们。

en: I couldn't run fast enough to keep up with them.
zh: 我跑得不够快，跟不上他们。

en: I was treated like a child by them.
zh: 我被他们当小孩子对待。

en: I waved my hand to them.
I had no choice but to read it out to them.
zh: 我别无选择，只能念给他们听。

en: I always tried to be strict with them and not to smile.
zh: 我总是尽量对他们严格，不苟言笑。

en: I gave them clothing and some food.
zh: 我给了他们衣服和一些食物。

en: I told them to study harder.
zh: 我告诉他们要努力学习。

en: I explained the rules of the game to them.
zh: 我向他们解释了游戏规则。

en: I feel very sorry that I had put them to so much trouble.
zh: 我为给他们带来这么多麻烦感到非常抱歉。

en: I congratulated them on the birth of their daughter.
zh: 我祝贺他们女儿的出生。

en: I have nothing to do with them.
zh: 我和他们没有任何关系。

en: I am studying it in cooperation with them.
zh: 我正在和他们合作研究它。

en: I went to Nikko along with them.
zh: 我和他们一起去了日光。

en: I saw them walking arm in arm.
zh: 我看到他们手挽着手走路。

en: I saw them play baseball.
I took for granted that they would give me a receipt.
zh: 我理所当然地认为他们会给我收据。

en: I am sure of their passing the examination.
zh: 我确信他们会通过考试。

en: I'm sure that they will pass the test.
zh: 我确信他们会通过考试。

en: I didn't resist the pressure they forced on me.
zh: 我没有抵抗他们强加给我的压力。

en: I'm annoyed about them forgetting to pay.
zh: 他们忘了付钱，我很恼火。

en: I saw them leave the coffee shop downstairs.
zh: 我看到他们离开了楼下的咖啡店。

en: I sat apart from them.
I saw them enter the bank.

en: I charged them too much money for their room.
zh: 我收了他们过高的房费。

en: I am older than him.
I'm older than he is.

I have an advantage over him.

I'm two years younger than he is.

I am not as tall as he.
I'm not as tall as he is.
I can't speak English as well as he.
I can't speak English as well as he can.
I am not older than he is.
I am not more intelligent than him.
I'm not as intelligent as he is.
I'm not as intelligent as him.
I pledged my loyalty to him.
I don't have as much money as he does.
I am of the opinion that he will succeed.
I strongly suspected that he had been lying.
zh: 我强烈怀疑他一直在撒谎。

en: I don't think he is fit for the job.
zh: 我认为他不适合这份工作。

en: I thought it best for him to say nothing about the matter.
zh: 我认为他最好对这件事什么都别说。

en: I cannot put up with his arrogance.
I can't stand his arrogance any longer.
zh: 我再也受不了他的傲慢了。

en: I cannot stand his arrogance any longer.
zh: 我再也受不了他的傲慢了。

en: I caught him by the arm.
I can't bring myself to trust his story.
I don't feel that I can trust what he says.
zh: 我觉得我无法相信他所说的话。

en: I don't trust his story.
I doubt his story.
I couldn't get the point of his speech.
zh: 我不明白他演讲的要点。

en: I didn't get the point of his speech.
zh: 我不明白他演讲的要点。

en: I couldn't even understand the main point of what he said.
zh: 我甚至不明白他所说的重点是什么。

en: I couldn't understand what he was saying.
I was much impressed by his speech.

en: I was much impressed by his story.

en: I was very impressed by his story.

en: I was much moved by his speech.
zh: 他的演讲深深地打动了我。

en: I was very moved by his speech.
zh: 他的演讲深深地打动了我。

en: I was very moved by his story.
zh: 他的故事深深地打动了我。

en: I was deeply impressed by his speech.
zh: 他的演讲给我留下了极其深刻的印象。

en: I listened to his talk.
I leaned forward, eager to catch every word he spoke.
zh: 我向前倾身，渴望抓住他说的每一个字。

en: I leaned forward so I could catch every word he said.
zh: 我向前倾身，这样我才能抓住他说的每一个字。

en: I was deeply moved by his speech.
zh: 他的演讲深深地感动了我。

en: I doubt the truth of his story.
zh: 我怀疑他的故事的真实性。

en: I prefer the updated version of his cookbook.
zh: 我更喜欢他食谱的更新版本。

en: I was fascinated with him.
I don't know the day when he will come.
I don't know what day he'll come.
I was forced to support his theory.
I cannot comply with his request.
I will accept his request.
I watched a ring of smoke that floated from his cigar into the air.
zh: 我看到一圈烟雾从他的雪茄中飘向空中。

en: I declined his invitation to dinner.
zh: 我拒绝了他共进晚餐的邀请。

en: I am going to assert his guilt.
I am his friend and will remain so.
zh: 我是他的朋友，而且会一直是。

en: I marveled at his courage.
I admire his courage.
I was irritated by his indecision.
zh: 他的犹豫不决让我很恼火。

en: I looked him in the eyes.
I have to obey his orders.
I don't know his name.
I don't know what his name is.
zh: 我不知道他叫什么名字。

en: I don't fully remember his name.
zh: 我不太记得他的名字了。

en: I don't remember his name.
I know him by name but I have never actually spoken to him.
zh: 我只知道他的名字，但从未和他真正说过话。

en: I don't know how to pronounce his name.
zh: 我不知道怎么念他的名字。

en: I was very much shocked to hear his daughter using such bad language.
zh: 听到他的女儿说这么粗俗的话，我感到非常震惊。

en: I don't like his rude manner.
zh: 我不喜欢他粗鲁的态度。

en: I was taken aback by his rudeness.
zh: 他的粗鲁让我吃了一惊。

en: I was surprised by his rudeness.

en: I am convinced of his innocence.
I had a dream about him.
I accepted a present from his sister.
zh: 我接受了他姐姐送的礼物。

en: I learned a lot from his books.
zh: 我从他的书中学习了很多。

en: I hesitated to leave his grave.
zh: 我犹豫着离开他的坟墓。

en: I am annoyed by his carelessness.
zh: 他的粗心大意让我很恼火。

en: I can't answer for his dishonesty.
zh: 我不能为他的不诚实负责。

en: I threatened to reveal his secret.
zh: 我威胁要揭露他的秘密。

en: I concluded his judgement was right.
zh: 我断定他的判断是正确的。

en: I clapped him on the back.
I don't have much faith in his ability.
zh: 我对他的能力没有太大的信心。

en: I was beside myself with his sudden appearance.
zh: 他的突然出现让我欣喜若狂。

en: I was surprised at the news of his sudden death.
zh: 听到他突然去世的消息，我很惊讶。

en: I impeached his motives.
I considered his originality of great importance.
zh: 我认为他的原创性非常重要。

en: I was arrested for aiding in his escape.
zh: 我因协助他逃跑而被捕。

en: I received a letter informing me of his arrival.
zh: 我收到一封信，通知我他要到了。

en: I wrote down his telephone number so that I might remember it.
zh: 我记下了他的电话号码，以便记住它。

en: I wrote down his phone number.
zh: 我记下了他的电话号码。

en: I politely turned down his offer and hung up.
zh: 我礼貌地拒绝了他的提议并挂断了电话。

en: I cannot but object to his proposal.
zh: 我不得不反对他的提议。

en: I began to doubt the accuracy of his statement.
zh: 我开始怀疑他陈述的准确性。

en: I interpreted his silence as consent.
zh: 我将他的沉默理解为同意。

en: I regard his advice as valuable.
zh: 我认为他的建议很有价值。

en: I acted on his advice.
I failed to go to his birthday party.
zh: 我没能去参加他的生日聚会。

en: I couldn't go to your birthday party.
zh: 我没能去参加你的生日聚会。

en: I couldn't come to your birthday party.
zh: 我没能来参加你的生日聚会。

en: I wasn't able to go to his birthday party.

en: I was unable to go to his birthday party.

en: I bought a new dress for her on his behalf.

en: I attended the meeting in place of him.
I cannot abide his manner.
I was annoyed at his behavior.
zh: 我对他的行为感到恼火。

en: I tried to repair his damaged prestige.
zh: 我试图修复他受损的声誉。

en: I wired him a message of congratulation on his graduation.
I have met neither of his sons.

en: I haven't met both of his sons.
zh: 我没有见过他的两个儿子。

en: I attended his funeral.
Words failed me in his presence.
zh: 在他面前，我说不出话来。

en: I was convinced by his explanation.
I can't recollect his explanation.
I can't remember his explanation.
I was not interested in his life.
zh: 我对他的生活不感兴趣。

en: I can't answer for his honesty.
I can't help doubting his honesty.
zh: 我忍不住怀疑他的诚实。

en: I could not find him out.
I am assured of his honesty.
I have confidence that he is honest.
I am convinced of his honesty.
When I heard of his success, I wrote a letter to him.
zh: 当我听说他成功时，我给他写了一封信。

en: I am anxious for his success.
zh: 我为他的成功感到焦虑。

en: I am doubtful of his success.
zh: 我对他的成功表示怀疑。

en: I am envious of his success.
I had a glimpse into the negative side of his character.
zh: 我瞥见了他人格的阴暗面。

en: I am not familiar with his character.
I cannot forget his kindness.
I do not like the way he treats others.
zh: 我不喜欢他对待别人的方式。

en: His kindness touched my heart.
zh: 他的善良感动了我的心。

en: I relied on his kindness.
I would like to repay him for his kindness.
I was admiring his new car.
zh: 我一直在欣赏他的新车。

en: I didn't expect his behavior to descend to such a disagreeable level.
zh: 我没想到他的行为会变得如此令人不快。

en: I can't understand his psychology.
I cannot help admiring his appetite.
zh: 我忍不住佩服他的胃口。

en: I don't like his taste in color.
zh: 我不喜欢他的颜色品味。

en: I accepted his invitation.
I dislike how he smiles.
I haven't read his novel, and my brother hasn't either.
zh: 我没读过他的小说，我弟弟也没读过。

en: I never read his novels without being deeply moved.
zh: 我每次读他的小说都会深受感动。

en: I haven't read all of his novels.
zh: 我还没有读过他所有的的小说。

en: I think little of his novel.
zh: 我认为他的小说没什么价值。

en: I think his novel is boring.
zh: 我认为他的小说很无聊。

en: I think that his novel is boring.
zh: 我认为他的小说很无聊。

en: I have read many of his novels in translation.
zh: 我读过很多他小说的翻译版本。

en: I read not only his novels but also his poems.
zh: 我不仅读他的小说，还读他的诗歌。

en: I am sure of his victory.
I asked for his help.
I look to him for help.
I repeated his exact statement.
zh: 我重复了他一字不差的陈述。

en: I repeated what he said word for word.
zh: 我一字不差地重复了他所说的话。

en: I repeated what he said exactly as he had said it.
zh: 我完全按照他所说的方式重复了他所说的话。

en: I repeated exactly what he had said.
zh: 我完全重复了他所说的话。

en: I heard news of his departure.
zh: 我听说了他离开的消息。

en: I helped him with his homework.
I delayed telling him about his uncle's death as long as I could.
zh: 我尽可能地拖延告诉他关于他叔叔去世的消息。

en: I forgot his address.
I know his address.
I know his address, but it's a secret.
zh: 我知道他的地址，但这是个秘密。

en: I was able to find out his address.
zh: 我设法查到了他的地址。

en: I took his name and address.
zh: 我记下了他的姓名和地址。

en: I was bored with his endless sermon.
zh: 我厌倦了他没完没了的说教。

en: I attended his classes and learned how to draw.
zh: 我参加了他的课程，学会了绘画。

en: I miss his lessons so much.
I took him by the wrist.
I glanced at his letter.
I do not want to reply to his letter.
I couldn't shake off his hand.
I held fast to his hand.
I observed that his hands were unsteady.
I'm working on his car.
I demanded that they be allowed to leave.
I saw his car make a turn to the right.
zh: 我看到他的车向右转弯。

en: I trust his executive ability.
I anticipated his question.
zh: 我预料到他会问这个问题。

en: I'm familiar with the way he asks questions.
I am familiar with the way he asks questions.
I could answer his question.
I didn't know how to answer his question.
zh: 我不知道该如何回答他的问题。

en: I was embarrassed by his rudeness.
zh: 我为他的粗鲁感到尴尬。

en: I couldn't put up with his rudeness.
I was surprised to hear of his failure.
zh: 听到他失败的消息，我很惊讶。

en: I dealt him a blow on the ear.
I was amazed at his abrupt resignation.
zh: 他对他的突然辞职感到惊讶。

en: I was surprised by his resignation.
zh: 我对他的辞职感到惊讶。

en: My name was called after his name.
zh: 他的名字之后叫到了我的名字。

en: I am indignant about the way he treated me.
zh: 我对他的待人方式感到愤慨。

en: I resent the way he treated me.
zh: 我怨恨他对待我的方式。

en: I was discouraged to hear of his death.
zh: 听到他去世的消息，我感到很沮丧。

en: I have a suspicion about his death.
I don't support his ideas.
I agreed to help him in his work.
I was at a loss how to answer his unexpected question.
zh: 我不知所措，不知道该如何回答他那突如其来的问题。

en: I am pleased with his work.
zh: 我对他的工作感到满意。

en: I will inherit his estate.
I inherited his estate.
I don't have much belief in his abilities.
zh: 我对他的能力不太信任。

en: I believe that his action was in the right.
zh: 我认为他的行为是正确的。

en: I believe the actions that he took were right.
zh: 我认为他采取的行动是正确的。

en: I sincerely hope for his happiness.
I envy him his luck.
I gave him a present in return for his favor.
zh: 为了报答他的恩惠，我送了他一份礼物。

en: I consoled him with his favorite food.
zh: 我用他最喜欢的食物安慰他。

en: I do not like the way he talks.
zh: 我不喜欢他说话的方式。

en: I followed him.
I followed him into his room.
zh: 我跟着他进了他的房间。

en: I was bored with his old jokes.
zh: 我对他的老笑话感到厌烦。

en: I didn't believe him at all.
I interpreted his remark as a threat.
zh: 我把他的话理解为一种威胁。

en: I affected not to understand what he was saying.
zh: 我装作听不懂他在说什么。

en: I pretended not to understand what he was saying.
zh: 我假装听不懂他在说什么。

en: I can't figure out what he is saying.
I can hardly understand what he says.
zh: 我几乎听不懂他在说什么。

en: I can barely understand what he's saying.
zh: 我几乎听不懂他在说什么。

en: I took him at his word.
I couldn't for the most part make out what he said.
zh: 我基本上听不清楚他在说什么。

en: I dissent from what he said.
I'm opposed to what he said.
I'm going to ascertain the truth of his statement.
zh: 我打算查明他所说的话是否属实。

en: I plan to check to see if what he said was true or not.
zh: 我计划核实一下他说的到底是不是真的。

en: I could not believe his statement.
I cannot understand anything he said.
zh: 我完全听不懂他在说什么。

en: I can't understand anything he said.
zh: 我完全听不懂他在说什么。

en: I didn't catch what he said.
I don't like what he said.
I did it the way he told me to.
I tried to listen to him carefully.
I believe whatever he says.
I couldn't understand anything that he said.
zh: 我什么都没听懂他说的话。

en: I felt encouraged to hear what he said.
zh: 听到他说的话，我感到很受鼓舞。

en: I believe what he says.
While he was talking, I guess I was absent-minded.
zh: 他说话的时候，我可能走神了。

en: I can understand him perfectly.
I couldn't understand him; I couldn't follow his way of speaking.
zh: 我听不懂他，我跟不上他的说话方式。

en: I could hardly understand him.
I could not make out what he meant.
zh: 我不明白他是什么意思。

en: I am very concerned about his health.
I was worried about his health.
I can bear witness to his innocence.
zh: 我可以证明他是无辜的。

en: I don't approve of his decision.
I want to know the reason for his absence.
zh: 我想知道他缺席的原因。

en: I was ignorant of his plan.
I didn't know about his plan.
I agreed with his plan.
I have not the slightest interest in his plans.
zh: 我对他的计划一点兴趣都没有。

en: I think his job resume is questionable.
zh: 我认为他的求职简历有问题。

en: I praised him for his diligence.
I grasped the entire structure of his argument.
zh: 我掌握了他的整个论证结构。

en: I lost the thread of his argument.
zh: 我失去了他论证的思路。

en: I was afraid that I might hurt his feelings.
zh: 我害怕我会伤害他的感情。

en: I struck on an idea that could change his mind.
zh: 我想到了一个可以改变他主意的主意。

en: I must live up to his expectations.
I could not come up to his expectations.
I couldn't live up to his expectations.
I couldn't meet his expectations.
I was bewildered at the sight of his strange behavior.
zh: 我看到他奇怪的行为感到很困惑。

en: I know him by sight, but not by name.
zh: 我见过他，但是不知道他的名字。

en: I know him by sight, but I have never actually spoken to him.
zh: 我见过他，但不曾和他讲过话。

en: I am sorry for his mistake.
zh: 我为他的错误感到抱歉。

en: Did I hurt his feelings?
I didn't say anything to hurt his feelings.
zh: 我没说过任何伤害他感情的话。

en: I mused on the meaning of his painting.
zh: 我沉思着他的画作的意义。

en: I thought about the meaning of his painting.
zh: 我思考着他的画作的意义。

en: I'm pointing the finger at his mistake.
I forgave his mistake.
I blamed him for his fault.
I know his family.
I remember calling at his house.
zh: 我记得我曾拜访过他家。

en: I called at his house.
I called at his house but found that he was out.
zh: 我拜访了他家，但他不在。

en: I found his house easily.
zh: 我很容易就找到了他家。

en: I found his house with ease.
zh: 我轻而易举地找到了他家。

en: Every time I go to his house, he is out.
zh: 每次我去他家，他都不在。

en: I classify his music as rock.
zh: 我把他的音乐归类为摇滚。

en: I am familiar with his music.
His music made a deep impression on me.
zh: 他的音乐给我留下了深刻的印象。

en: I was impressed by his music.
zh: 我对他的音乐印象深刻。

en: I like his music.
I was bored with his speech.
zh: 我对他的演讲感到厌烦。

en: I admire his skill at driving.
I envied him his good fortune.
It has dawned on me that I mistook his intention.
zh: 我突然意识到我误解了他的意图。

en: I cared little for his opinion.
I don't make much of his opinion.
I couldn't agree with his opinion.
I did so at his request.
zh: 我是应他的要求这样做的。

en: I went to the hospital to inquire after his health.
zh: 我去医院打听他的病情。

en: I went to the hospital to ask about his health.
zh: 我去医院询问他的健康状况。

en: I asked after him.
I brushed by him while running.
zh: 我跑步时从他身边擦过。

en: I went over his report, but couldn't find any mistakes.
zh: 我仔细检查了他的报告，但没发现任何错误。

en: I'm looking over his report.
I found myself listening to his records.
zh: 我发现自己在听他的唱片。

en: I can't trust such a man as he.
zh: 我无法信任他这样的人。

en: I cannot trust a person like that.
I can't trust people like him.
zh: 我不能信任像他这样的人。

en: I listened to some of his records.
I interpreted what he said in French into Japanese.
zh: 我把他说的法语翻译成了日语。

en: I want to have his only daughter for my wife.
zh: 我想娶他唯一的女儿为妻。

en: I want to sing to his piano accompaniment.
zh: 我想在他的钢琴伴奏下唱歌。

en: I often visited his house.
I will do anything for him.
zh: 为了他，我什么都愿意做。

en: He has no friends besides me.
I held his sleeve.
I was deeply affected by his speech.
I couldn't catch on to the joke he told us.
I couldn't understand his joke.
I didn't get his joke.
I can't forgive him for what he did.
zh: 我无法原谅他所做的事情。

en: He doesn't believe me at all.
I regard him as a man of character.
zh: 我把他看作一个有品格的人。

en: I cannot help thinking about him.
I know him like a book.
I like him, but at the same time I don't really trust him.
zh: 我喜欢他，但同时我并不真正信任他。

en: I saw his mother scold him.
I would like to meet his father.
I may as well stay alone as keep him company.
zh: 我宁愿独自一人，也不愿和他在一起。

en: I cannot help laughing at his odd manner.
zh: 我忍不住嘲笑他古怪的举止。

en: I held him by the collar.
I can't forget his kindness.
I landed him a blow on the chin.
zh: 我朝他的下巴打了一拳。

en: I punched him in the chin.
zh: 我朝他的下巴打了一拳。

en: I punched his jaw.
I have read twice as many books as he has.
zh: 我读过的书是他读过的书的两倍。

en: I could not speak to him.
I meet with him once every six months.
I told him to come.
I told him to keep his promise.
I asked him if he would go there the next day.
zh: 我问他第二天是否去那里。

en: I am not acquainted with him.
I waved him back.
I called him a coward to his face.
I complained to him face to face.
I asked him to go there tomorrow.
I asked him what his name was.
I was trying to tell him what had really happened, but he cut me short.
zh: 我正想告诉他到底发生了什么，但他打断了我。

en: I gave him a few books.
I thanked him for lending me a book.
zh: 我感谢他借给我一本书。

en: I gave him a book.
I will take my revenge on him.
I was bound to answer him.
I gave my cold to him.
I told him to leave the room.
I do not want him to be careless.
I owe him $100.
I asked him about his new book.
zh: 我问了他关于他的新书。

en: I told him, once for all, that I would not marry him.
zh: 我彻底地告诉他，我不会嫁给他。

en: I told him that he was wrong.
I beat him on points.
I congratulated him on passing the entrance exam.
zh: 我祝贺他通过了入学考试。

en: I whispered to him to come in.
I told him not to be late again.
zh: 我告诉他不要再迟到了。

en: I could not help feeling sympathy with him.
zh: 我不禁对他产生了同情。

en: I gave him some good advice about buying land.
zh: 我给了他一些关于买地的好建议。

en: I called him, but the line was busy.
zh: 我给他打电话，但是占线。

en: I called him up and asked his schedule.
zh: 我给他打电话，问了他的日程安排。

en: I telephoned him the message.
zh: 我打电话告诉了他这个消息。

en: I forgot to give him the message.
zh: 我忘了把消息告诉他了。

en: I met him on the street.
I can run fast enough to catch up with him.
zh: 我跑得足够快能追上他。

en: I haven't met him in person, but I know of him.
zh: 我没见过他本人，但我听说过他。

en: I wrote him a long letter, but he sent me no reply.
zh: 我给他写了一封很长的信，但他没有回复我。

en: I turned to him for advice.
I gave him advice, to which he paid no attention.
zh: 我给了他建议，但他根本没听。

en: I gave him some advice.
I requested him to keep me informed.
I answered for him.
I gave him much trouble.
I caused him a lot of trouble.
zh: 我给他造成了很多麻烦。

en: I bid against him.
I chose him a nice tie.
zh: 我给他选了一条漂亮的领带。

en: I claimed damages against him.
I am in debt to him for 1,000 yen.
I remember meeting that man before.
zh: 我记得以前见过那个人。

en: I explained it to him.
I don't want to see him at all.
I explained it to him, only to make him confused.
zh: 我向他解释了，结果反而让他更困惑。

en: I told him to be quiet.
I congratulated him on his success.
I gave some books to him.
I had not a little difficulty in bringing the truth home to him.
zh: 我费了很大劲才让他明白真相。

en: I confided my troubles to him.
zh: 我向他倾诉了我的烦恼。

en: I furnished him with food.
I was all the more angry because I was laughed at by him.
zh: 我因为被他嘲笑而更加生气。

en: I made him sweep the floor.
I gave him what little information I had.
zh: 我把他仅有的一点信息都给了他。

en: I appeal to him for his advice.
I thanked him for helping me.
I asked him to help me.
I asked him if he would help me.
I besought him to help me.
I intend him to help me with my homework.
zh: 我打算让他帮我做作业。

en: I had him do my homework.
I gave him my address.
I will get him to come and help me.
I put handcuffs on him.
I have put off writing to him till today.
zh: 我一直拖到今天才给他写信。

en: I had the letter written by him.
zh: 我请他写了这封信。（信是由他写的）

en: I had him write the letter for me.
zh: 我让他帮我写了这封信。

en: I asked him if he had got my letter.
zh: 我问他是否收到了我的信。

en: I suggested to him.
I think it's better not to lend him a hand.
I had him wash the car.
I got him to repair my car.
I asked him to drive me home.
I reminded him of his interview with the president.
zh: 我提醒他与总统的面试。

en: I asked him a question.
I asked a question of him.
I regret having been rude to him.
I was disappointed in him.
I could not persuade him of my honesty.
zh: 我无法说服他相信我的诚实。

en: I got him to fix my bicycle.
zh: 我让他修理了我的自行车。

en: I had him mend my watch.
zh: 我让他修理了我的手表。

en: I had my watch mended by him.
zh: 我让ta把我的手表修好了。

en: I had him repair my watch.
zh: 我让他修理了我的手表。

en: I had him fix my watch.
zh: 我让他修理了我的手表。

en: It was demanded that I tell him the truth.
zh: 有人要求我告诉他真相。

en: I challenged him to a game.
zh: 我向他挑战了一场比赛。

en: I would like him to stay with us.
zh: 我希望他能和我们住在一起。

en: I tried to convince him of my innocence.
zh: 我试图让他相信我是无辜的。

en: I got him to mend my shoes.
zh: 我让他修补了我的鞋子。

en: I discouraged him from marrying me.
I told him about our school.
zh: 我告诉了他关于我们学校的事情。

en: I asked him if I could read them.
zh: 我问他我是否可以阅读它们。

en: I paid him the money due to him.
I paid him four dollars.
I agree with him.
I bought him a magazine.
I lent him a magazine.
I told him that I would do my best.
zh: 我告诉他我会尽力而为。

en: I advise him to come back at once.
I must study hard in order to keep up with him.
zh: 我必须努力学习才能赶上他。
